# zeus_pool (Resource)

Zeus address pool

## Example Usage

```terraform
provider "zeus" {
  endpoint = "http://localhost:8080"
  token    = "changeme"
}

resource "zeus_pool" "example" {
  start   = 3232235777 # 192.168.1.1 as integer
  gateway = 3232236030 # 192.168.1.254 as integer
  size    = 16
  region  = "us-east-1"
}

data "zeus_pool" "by_id" {
  id = zeus_pool.example.id
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `gateway` (Number) Gateway address (integer form)
- `region` (String) Region identifier
- `size` (Number) Pool size
- `start` (Number) Start address (integer form)

### Read-Only

- `begin` (String)
- `end` (String)
- `friendly_name` (String)
- `gateway_ip` (String)
- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `state` (List of Number)

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Import an existing pool by ID
terraform import zeus_pool.example "pool-id"
```
